Version: 1.1.1

Portfile ÂèòÈáè

Ëøô‰∫õÊòØ kmpkg Ëá™Âä®ËÆæÁΩÆÁöÑÂèòÈáèÔºåÂèØÂú®‰ªª‰ΩïÁ´ØÂè£‰∏≠‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ

These are variables set automatically by kmpkg for use in any port. They should not be modified by the port.

Full list of variables is defined in the kmpkg_common_definitions module.

PORT‚Äã

The name of the port that is currently being built.

VERSION‚Äã

The version of the port that is currently being built.

Does not contain the "port-version".

KMPKG_TARGET_IS_<system>‚Äã

Defined to a true value if building for <system>.

Supported systems:

  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_WINDOWS (also true for UWP and MinGW)
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_UWP
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_MINGW
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_LINUX
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_OSX
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_IOS
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_ANDROID
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_FREEBSD
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_OPENBSD
  • KMPKG_TARGET_IS_EMSCRIPTEN

KMPKG_HOST_IS_<system>‚Äã

Defined to a true value if building on <system>.

Supported systems:

  • KMPKG_HOST_IS_WINDOWS
  • KMPKG_HOST_IS_OSX
  • KMPKG_HOST_IS_LINUX
  • KMPKG_HOST_IS_FREEBSD
  • KMPKG_HOST_IS_OPENBSD

KMPKG_HOST_PATH_SEPARATOR‚Äã

Host specific path separator.

Always use quotes when expanding KMPKG_HOST_PATH_SEPARATOR since it may contain a semicolon. For example:

set(ENV{SOMEPATH} "$ENV{SOMEPATH}${KMPKG_HOST_PATH_SEPARATOR}${my_extra_path}")

KMPKG_HOST_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX‚Äã

Executable suffix for the building system.

This is set to ".exe" on Windows and "" on other platforms.

KMPKG_TARGET_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX‚Äã

Executable suffix for the built-for system.

This is set to ".exe" when KMPKG_TARGET_IS_WINDOWS and "" otherwise.

KMPKG_HOST_BUNDLE_SUFFIX‚Äã

Bundle suffix of the building system.

KMPKG_TARGET_BUNDLE_SUFFIX‚Äã

Bundle suffix of the built-for system.

KMPKG_TARGET_STATIC_LIBRARY_PREFIX‚Äã

Static library prefix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_PREFIX.

KMPKG_TARGET_STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX‚Äã

Static library suffix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX.

KMPKG_TARGET_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX‚Äã

Shared (dynamic) library prefix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX.

KMPKG_TARGET_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX‚Äã

Shared (dynamic) library suffix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX.

KMPKG_TARGET_IMPORT_LIBRARY_PREFIX‚Äã

Import library prefix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_IMPORT_LIBRARY_PREFIX.

KMPKG_TARGET_IMPORT_LIBRARY_SUFFIX‚Äã

Import library suffix for the built-for system.

See also CMAKE_IMPORT_LIBRARY_SUFFIX.

KMPKG_FIND_LIBRARY_PREFIXES‚Äã

Prefixes used for find_library() calls in portfiles.

These are set to

KMPKG_FIND_LIBRARY_SUFFIXES‚Äã

Suffixes used for find_library() calls in portfiles.

TARGET_TRIPLET‚Äã

The name of the triplet being built for.

CURRENT_INSTALLED_DIR‚Äã

The absolute path to the installed files for the target triplet.

HOST_TRIPLET‚Äã

The name of the triplet that matches the building system.

CURRENT_HOST_INSTALLED_DIR‚Äã

The absolute path to the installed files for the host triplet.

KMPKG_CROSSCOMPILING‚Äã

Whether kmpkg is compiling for a different system than the building machine.

This is the same as comparing TARGET_TRIPLET and HOST_TRIPLET for equality. If the triplets are different, ports must not assume that they can run the results of a build.

For example, when compiling for Android from MacOS, KMPKG_CROSSCOMPILING will be set to a true value.

Last updated on May 24, 2025 by Jeff lothar

  • KMPKG_CROSSCOMPILING
